Hello everyone, this is the Arts Center of NDHU.

In order to ensure everyone's safety, after many discussions, the event, "The Sound of Tokyo Jazz - Hideo Oyama Quartet", which was originally scheduled for April 24(Wed.), will be held on the same date but changed to a live stream concert. Due to the safety considerations, the on-site spots will not be offered. We would like to invite all of the faculties and students to enjoy this wonderful international performance online, and use the arts to soothe our shocked moods.

The international train of the Arts Center comes to the third stop, Tokyo, Japan.
Led by contemporary saxophone master, Hideo Oyama, all-star cast of Japan jazz musicians, which includes pianist Hideaki Yoshioka, drummer Eiichiro Tohyama, and Taiwanese bassist WeiShang, Lin, will bring bebop, which was from New York on the east coast of the United States, to everyone on April 24th.
Bebop is a jazz music style which originated from New York city in the United States in the 20th century. After spreading to Japan, being extracted and internalized nearly a century, bebop became part of Japan's jazz music style. In this concert, the Oyama Hideo Quartet will not only perform the masterpieces in Hard Bebop Era from such as Horace Silver, Oliver Nelson, Phil Woods,etc., but also the original works from Hideo Oyama himself. Because of the relationship in his fatherâ€™s generation, Hideo Oyama has a sincere feeling for Taiwan. Hoping to make some contribution to the relation between Taiwan and Japan, he would like to bring bebop, the symbolization of innovation and freedom, to Taiwanâ€™s audiences, and wish all of the music could touch the deepest part of their souls.
